messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to punish the people. This is because the people did not follow the rules. Every year, they pick one boy and one girl from each part of the country. The children are between 12 and 18 years old. They must fight in a battle. Only one person can stay alive. The chosen teenagers are called 'tributes'. A tribute is a person who has to fight in the games. All the people in the country must watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text uses the B1-level words 'punish' and 'battle'. Strict A2 adherence requires replacing these. The word 'battle' could be avoided by rephrasing to 'They must fight each other'. The concept of 'punish' could be explained with simpler terms, for example: 'The government uses the games to hurt the people because they did not follow the rules'.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text violates the strict A2 vocabulary rule. The word 'teenagers' is B1 level. Replace it with 'young people' or 'the chosen boy and girl'. Additionally, the sentence 'The chosen teenagers are called 'tributes'' uses a passive voice structure ('are called'). While this is a common form, active voice is required for strict A2 adherence. The simplification of complex ideas like 'punished for rebelling' into 'hurt the people... because the people did not follow the rules' is otherwise acceptable.
